column4: i'm using an ati mobile 5870, with fglrx; my mouse doesn't respond with the trackpad or when i set it to use keyboard keys, wut do
do you have a spare external mouse to plugin for temporary use?
I would suggest doing ctrl + alt + f1 then logging in and doing sudo su then apt-get update followed by apt-get upgrade to make sure your system is up to date then type reboot
fresh install is out of date by time its first burned always updates rolling out you sure?
and you rebooted to make sure all the new modules or kernel are loaded properly?
is there a touchpad on/off button?

when i used the open source drivers, it worked well, but the resolution was way off; when i used recent fglrx drivers, the resolution was fine but the mouse was too responsive and i couldn't tap to click; with ubuntu's current fglrx drivers, my mouse doesn't work (with keyboard mouse or trackpad)
in /var/log there is a xorg output there and you can try dmesg to see if you find any errors when loading up your touchpad
I'm not sure if lshw lists such information about peripherals but perhaps there is a suitable ls based option
it would be good to know what the system is recognizing the device as
pastebin all the info you get there should help to narrow things down
